Video.Title: Curiosity Rover Daily Martian Weather Report Dwarf Planets Exploring Planets in the Classroom Mars Exploration Rover Mission Mars Global Surveyor Mars Orbiter Camera Image Gallery Mars Today MSSS Viking Image Archive The Nine Eight Planets: Planets of the Solar System Planets of the solar system Planetary Orbits Pluto demoted to dwarf planet Solar System Facts Solar System Live view of the Inner planets Solar System Scale Model Page Solar System: True to Scale Surface of Mars colored by height Views of the Solar System Virtual Solar System by National Geographic Welcome to the Planets What would you weigh on other planets? What would I weigh on...? World"s largest scale model of the Solar System Roadside America article about the model
Video.Description: Planets Curiosity Rover - access to news and multimedia files Daily Martian Weather Report - The Mars Global Surveyor Radio Science Team conducted a detailed study of the Martian atmosphere, and results from their study were presented on this site in the form of a daily weather report for the planet Mars. The site is not being updated any longer, but a large amount of Martian atmosphere/weather data is available. Dwarf Planets - background on dwarf planets plus a list of links Exploring Planets in the Classroom - Hands-on Activities for Science Classes. More than 25 hands-on science activities are provided in classroom-ready pages for both teachers and students for exploring Earth, the planets, geology, and space sciences. Mars Exploration Rover Mission - Latest News From Spirit and Opportunity Mars Global Surveyor Mars Orbiter Camera Image Gallery - Mars Orbiter Camera (MOC) Image Gallery! This site contains the pictures of Mars acquired by NASA`s Mars Global Surveyor (MGS) orbiter through 31 January 2001. MOC is operated daily at Malin Space Science Systems. The company is responsible for archiving the camera data once they are received on Earth.[this expired page is from the Internet Archive known as the Wayback Machine] Mars Today - current conditions on Mars and its relationship to Earth MSSS Viking Image Archive - This page provides access to a large fraction of the set of images taken by the Viking orbiters from 1976 to 1980. [this expired page is from the Internet Archive known as the Wayback Machine] The Nine Eight Planets: A Multimedia Tour of the Solar System Planets of the Solar System - includes a 3D model of the solar system Planets of the solar system - Click on a planet to get a short bit of information about each one. [relative sizes are not accurate] Planetary Orbits - Shockwave simulation showing planetary orbits Pluto demoted to dwarf planet - CNN report from 1:12 p.m. EDT, August 27, 2006 Solar System Facts - a more elementary treatment of the Solar System for younger students Solar System Live - Where are the planets right now. Go to this site to find. You can also reset the date for times in the past or future to see where the plants were, or will be. A view of the Inner planets is also available. Solar System Scale Model Page - Making scale models of the solar system is a useful way to learn about it. This page lists various related pages. Solar System: True to Scale - scroll forever to find the planets, and don`t try to print this site (1487 pages almost all black!) Surface of Mars colored by height - click and drag the image to rotate the planet Views of the Solar System - This site presents a vivid multimedia adventure unfolding the splendor of the Sun, planets, moons, comets, asteroids, and more. Discover the latest scientific information, or study the history of space exploration, rocketry, early astronauts, space missions, spacecraft through a vast archive of photographs, scientific facts, text, graphics and videos. Views of the Solar System offers enhanced exploration and educational enjoyment of the solar system and beyond. Virtual Solar System by National Geographic - your chance to discover the wonders of our solar system in a spectacular 3-D environment. Take a fly-by tour of the sun and each planet in its orbit, observe close-up views of the planets, extraterrestrial weather patterns, and more. Welcome to the Planets - This is a collection of many of the best images from NASA`s planetary exploration program. What would you weigh on other planets? Enter your weight, select calculate and see what you would weigh on each of the other planets. See an Excel workbook that does the same thing. What would I weigh on...? - an interactive workbook which uses hyperlinks and protected cells. Calculate your weight on another planet. World`s largest scale model of the Solar System - Welcome to the home of Jupiter, part of the world`s largest scale model of the solar system Roadside America article about the model
Video.Author: Internet4Classrooms

Video.Title: How to Read a Climograph Climographs of Selected U.S. Cities Climate Information Interactive Climate Map Koppen"s Climate Classification U.S. Climate at a Glance United States Climate Page World Climate
Video.Description: Climographs How to Read a Climograph - Every place on Earth has weather. However, different places on Earth have different types of `typical` weather. A quick way to get an idea of the climate of a particular place is to look at a `climate-graph,` or `climograph.` Climographs of Selected U.S. Cities - A climograph plots monthly average temperature and precipitation for some location. It provides a quick way of characterizing the climate of a particular place. To view a climograph for one of the U.S. cities listed, click on the city name or the corresponding dot on the map. Climate Information - a source of raw data that your students might use to make their own climograph Interactive Climate Map - Move your cursor over a rectangle to see a climograph. Click on the rectangle to view information about the climate at that location Koppen`s Climate Classification - Click on a blue `x` to see the climograph for that location U.S. Climate at a Glance - from the National Climatic Data Center in Asheville, North Carolina United States Climate Page - (Click on state of interest, then select a city to see a climograph) World Climate - What the weather is normally like for tens of thousands of places worldwide! WorldClimate.com contains over 85,000 records of world climate data (historical weather averages)
Video.Author: Internet4Classrooms

In this activity, students will come up with their own classification schemes, and then use an online interactive to choose plants and animals that fit into different categories.

Video.Title: All Systems Go!
Video.Description: Kids are aware of many parts of the body—organs, bones, blood, etc. Through this online interactive activity, kids learn about the concept of separate body parts working together to build a body system. A system is a collection of things and processes (and often people) that interact to perform some function. Help your kids explore the inside of the human body with this activity.

Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Gravity Assist Simulator
Video.Description: The Gravity Assist Simulator takes you through a series of simulated collisions to show how the New Horizon and Messenger spacecraft will use planned collisions to extend their missions.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Gravity Launch
Video.Description: There are a lot of challenges with space flight. One is simply getting the rocket off the ground. This is because the thrust to launch a rocket has to work against the force of gravity. So, there are two forces at play in this game: earth’s gravitational pull and thrust. Your kids will play with a computer interactive that demonstrates these two forces in action.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Gravity Launch App
Video.Description: Gravity Launch is an app where you try to get a rocket to its destination to learn about gravity.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Gravity Launch Mobile
Video.Description: In this lesson, students explore how the earth's and moon's gravity affect the path of a rocket launched into space.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: High Seas
Video.Description: This resource will help you learn about waves and their behaviors.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Human Body App
Video.Description: Go on an exploration of what we're made of and how we work with this Human Body app, from Tinybop.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: iCell App
Video.Description: iCell gives you an interactive, 3D view inside a cell.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: iNaturalist App
Video.Description: This app lets you record observations from nature and share them with the iNaturalist online community.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Interactive Sound Ruler
Video.Description: At this site, an interactive table demonstrates real-world sounds ranging from 0-140 decibels.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Invention at Play
Video.Description: This site challenges you to explore, question, invent, and collaborate to make your own discoveries.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Journey North App
Video.Description: From the people behind the Journey North website comes this free citizen science app to help you track migrations and seasons.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Kilo-What?
Video.Description: This resource provides an introduction to electricity and power plants.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Kinetic City
Video.Description: Kinetic City is a web-based science program that will help you learn more about a lot of different science topics.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Leafsnap App
Video.Description: Leafsnap is a terrific app for anyone with an iPhone or iPad in the great outdoors.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Learner.org
Video.Description: Feed your brain by indulging in one of the many interactive activities found on this delightful site.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Life Processes
Video.Description: This resource helps you understand the seven life processes.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Look at Those Seeds Grow!
Video.Description: In this lesson students earn the basic parts of seeds and what they need to grow into a plant.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Looking at the Night Sky
Video.Description: This lesson helps students understand that the patterns of stars in the sky stay the same and different stars can be seen in different seasons.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Lunar Cycle
Video.Description: This lesson offers activity ideas and discussion questions to facilitate students' learning about the phases of the Moon.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Lunar Cycle 1: Calendar
Video.Description: This tool includes printable calendars where you can record your observations of the moon. In addition, it provides illustrations of the phases of the moon (a full lunar cycle) that can be printed and cut out for a hands-on activity where you can place the phases of the moon in the correct order on a calendar.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Lunar Cycle 2: The Challenge
Video.Description: This activity allows you to "drag" pictures of different phases of the moon to their correct places in lunar cycles.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Make a Mission
Video.Description: This activity introduces kids to the MESSENGER Mission to the planet Mercury. The engineers who designed the spacecraft and the instrument payload had to consider function, space (or volume), and cost. In this online interactive, your kids will have the chance to try to fit all the critical equipment into the cargo bay of a spacecraft by taking into account space and cost constraints.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: MapMachine
Video.Description: This MapMachine resource from National Geographic provides maps of basically any location on earth.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Marble Mania
Video.Description: Introduce your kids to probability and chance with a fun interactive. By flipping coins and pulling marbles out of a virtual bag, students begin to develop a basic understanding of probabilities, how they are determined, and how the outcome of an experiment can be affected by the number of times it is conducted.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: MARE's Build a Fish
Video.Description: In this interactive activity, you must build a fish whose adaptations make it suited to its ocean environment.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Matific App
Video.Description: Matific is a hands-on and interactive app that uses bite-sized apps for tablets and personal computers to teach math skills.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Meteor Counter App
Video.Description: This app from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) will help you count meteors during a meteor shower.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Migration Station
Video.Description: This resource from the National Geographic uses a virtual train station to promote understanding of why people migrate.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Mitosis App
Video.Description: The Mitosis app is a good tool to use if you are learning about mitosis in your high-school biology class.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Mix-n-Match
Video.Description: With this online exhibit by the Exploratorium, you will learn that with just three colors of light (red, blue, and green) you can make over 16 million colors!
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Mixing Primary Colors
Video.Description: This is an interactive activity that demonstrates how to mix colors with light and with paints or dyes
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Models of the Water Cycle
Video.Description: In this lesson, students develop an understanding of the water cycle by building and evaluating two different physical models.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Molecules App
Video.Description: Molecules is a free application for the iPhone, iPod touch, and iPad that allows you to view three-dimensional renderings of molecules and manipulate them using your fingers.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Monster Bugs
Video.Description: With this resource, you can make your own virtual bug at the Monster Bugs section of The Magic Schoolbus website.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Muscles
Video.Description: In this interactive, produced by BBC Science & Nature, students will have fun learning about the muscles of the human body.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: My Life as an Elk
Video.Description: This interactive story lets you take on the identity of a newborn elk calf and make choices as it grows up in Yellowstone National Park.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: My Senses Tell Me...
Video.Description: In this lesson, students learn about how their five senses help them gather information from the world around them.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: NASA Visualization Explorer App
Video.Description: The NASA Visualization Explorer provides visualizations, animations, and images of our sun and the universe.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Nervous System
Video.Description: In this interactive, produced by BBC Science & Nature, students will learn about how different body parts are connected to the nervous system.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Net Frog
Video.Description: Net Frog provides a virtual opportunity for students to perform muscle and skin incisions of frogs.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Nobelprize.org
Video.Description: Learn about The Nobel Prizes that have been awarded since 1901, as well as the criteria and nomination process that are used to select the winners.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Nowhere to Hide
Video.Description: Through the use of an interactive activity, this lesson focuses on the concept of natural selection.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Number Cruncher
Video.Description: This interactive challenges students to consider mathematical equations to get from one number to another in a math maze.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Obesity and Childhood Nutrition Town Hall
Video.Description: This site has information about an event on understanding the science behind obesity and childhood nutrition that took place at the 2008 AAAS Annual Meeting.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Oil Refining: A Closer Look
Video.Description: This resource contains a video and an interactive explaining how petroleum was formed and how it is processed.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Orbit & Rotation
Video.Description: This resource is an animation showing the orbit and rotation of Mercury around the sun.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Orbits App
Video.Description: This app can help you learn how the solar system works.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Organs
Video.Description: In this interactive on organs, produced by BBC Science & Nature, students will learn about the organs of the human body.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Peanuts & Crackerjacks
Video.Description: This tool teaches basic economics through the economics of professional sports (baseball, football, basketball, and hockey).
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Peering Inside the Body
Video.Description: This site describes the sophisticated tools and techniques used in medical imaging including the PET scan, X ray, angiography, ultrasound, and CT Scan.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Periodic Table of the Elements App
Video.Description: This app is an electronic version of the Periodic Table of the Elements. It was developed by EMD (now Merck) Chemicals.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Periodical Cicada Survival
Video.Description: In this lesson, students explore defense mechanisms involved in predatory/prey relationships.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Periodical Cicadas
Video.Description: Learn more about cicadas, particularly the periodical species.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Places in the Sun
Video.Description: This animation allows you to see a side-by-side comparison of the sun on Earth and Mercury.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Planet Mass Comparison
Video.Description: This interactive helps visualize the differences between any two of these objects by putting them side by side on an old-fashioned balance scale.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Planet Size Comparison
Video.Description: In this animation, you can find out the dimensions for each planet as well as how they compare in size.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Planets App
Video.Description: The Planets App, by Q Continuum, provides several different ways for you to get information about objects in the sky.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Plant Hunter
Video.Description: Take a virtual walk through the The New York Botanical Garden, exploring 66 plants from around the globe through photographs, videos, and interactive games.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Pottery 1: Pottery Quest
Video.Description: In this lesson, students learn that the production of ceramic pottery requires detailed knowledge of the physical properties of different clays and tempering materials, as well as knowledge about how these combine and react under specific firing conditions.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Power Play
Video.Description: In this lesson, students broaden their ability to identify energy sources, the energy transformation process, and build basic machines/systems that use energy transformations to get work done.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Power Up!
Video.Description: This interactive challenges students to think about the positive and negative consequences of various types of power.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Powers of Ten
Video.Description: This site contains resources based on the Powers of Ten concept and helps students understand and compare the size of things in our world and universe.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Project BudBurst App
Video.Description: Project BudBurst is part of a citizen science program designed to encourage local participation in a national research effort.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Project Noah App
Video.Description: Project Noah is a global study that encourages nature lovers to document the wildlife they encounter.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Puberty
Video.Description: In this interactive, produced by BBC Science & Nature, students will be able to learn about the changes their bodies go through during puberty.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Quicksilver Web Module
Video.Description: This is a problem-based exercise that teaches about mercury in the environment using a fictitious town called Quicksilver, a gold mining town in the 1800s.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Race: Are We So Different?
Video.Description: A project of the American Anthropological Association, Race: Are We So Different? looks at human variation and what it means to be a human being.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Reaction Time 2: Zap!
Video.Description: This lesson shows how skills can improve through practice and awareness, using a game that focuses on both visual and auditory responsiveness.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Reel Timeline
Video.Description: This resource is a NOVA timeline covering the development of special effects in movies from the 1890s to the 1990s.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Robotics: At Your Command
Video.Description: This resource let's you drive on the moon by simulating two approaches to robotic exploration.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Scale of the Universe 2
Video.Description: The Scale of the Universe takes you on a ride down to the smallest thing theorized by scientists and then out to the vastness of the universe.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: SCI: Skin Cancer Investigation
Video.Description: This interactive gives students the opportunity to learn about skin cancer diagnosis and prevention.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Science Apps
Video.Description: Science NetLinks reviews STEM-related apps for both the iPad and the Android.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Science Glossary App
Video.Description: This app is a vast compilation of scientific and mathematical information from Vision Learning.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Science NetLinks Staff Picks, Grades 9-12
Video.Description: The Science NetLinks staff highlight some of our favorite resources on the site.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Science360 App
Video.Description: Science360 is a wonderful app from the Science360 Knowledge Network.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: ScienceEd
Video.Description: Through experiments, demonstrations, games, videos and the personal experiences of practicing scientists, ScienceEd introduces children to the mysteries and marvels of science.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Shape It Up
Video.Description: This lesson explores how the earth’s landscape features change and always have through forces of nature such as wind, water, glaciation, and volcanism.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Shape It Up!
Video.Description: This interactive from Kinetic City provides students with the opportunity to experience how mountains, rivers, and canyons were formed.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Sheep Brain Dissection
Video.Description: A sheep brain is used to teach about memory and where it takes place because its brain structure and functions are similar to the human brain.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Simple Machines
Video.Description: Edheads is an interactive site about simple and compound machines that includes a challenge for students to identify simple machines in everyday objects.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Sizing Up the Universe
Video.Description: This interactive from the Smithsonian Institution helps you visualize the scale and distances between objects in our solar system.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skeleton
Video.Description: This interactive, produced by BBC Science & Nature, contains a great deal of information about the skeletal system.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skin as an Organ
Video.Description: In this lesson, students examine the skin and how it functions as an organ and as part of a larger body system.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skin Cancer 1: Exposing Healthy Skin to the Sun
Video.Description: In this lesson, students develop an understanding of the science behind keeping skin healthy.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skin Cancer 2: Types, Prevention, and Detection
Video.Description: In this lesson, students develop an understanding of skin cancer and its different types, how it can be detected, and how it can be prevented.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skin Care: Acne
Video.Description: In this lesson, students learn about the underlying causes, prevention, and treatment of acne.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Skull Diversity
Video.Description: In this lesson, students explore skulls that are part of an online exhibit at the California Academy of Sciences.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Slush Rush
Video.Description: This lesson introduces students to how computer models can help people make decisions or learn about real-world events.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Sound Uncovered App
Video.Description: With this interactive collection from the Exploratorium, you can explore sound through auditory illusions, acoustic phenomena, and other things that go bump, beep, boom, and vroom.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Star Light, Star Bright
Video.Description: This lesson will help high-school students understand how star brightness in the night sky is classified by various orders of magnitude. It uses the GoSkyWatch Planetarium app to help students look at stars in the night sky and determine apparent magnitude and distances of various stars in the night sky.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Star Search
Video.Description: This interactive encourages students to find constellations in the night sky of the four seasons.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Summer Science Fun
Video.Description: This collection offers STEM-related online resources, book suggestions, and hands-on activities for keeping young minds limber during a prolonged summer break from formal learning.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Sun & Skin
Video.Description: In this lesson, students will discuss what they already know about the impact sun exposure has on their skin and what they typically do to protect themselves, if anything.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Systems of the Human Body
Video.Description: This lesson explores the different systems within the body and how they work independently and together to form a functioning human body.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Take the Case: Chain of Evidence
Video.Description: Students will use the interactive Take the Case: Chain of Evidence to investigate a crime scene and analyze evidence, interview suspects, and solve the case.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Tech Topics: Electricity
Video.Description: This site provides an introduction to electricity as well as a discussion about how electricity is converted into heat energy, light energy, and motion energy.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Technology and Oil
Video.Description: This lesson demonstrates how much our society depends on petroleum products and shows how advances in technology have allowed us to find, obtain, and transport oil more efficiently.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Technology at Home
Video.Description: This site lets you go back through the twentieth century to find out when everyday items such as computers, TVs, and CD players first appeared in homes.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Tesla: Inside the Lab
Video.Description: This resource explores the brilliant inventions of Nikola Tesla which include the radio and the remote control.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Cyber-rific Periodic Table of the Elements
Video.Description: Molecule Man introduces you to the Cyber-rific Periodic Table of the Elements, which features descriptions of the elements.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Economics of Income: If You're So Smart, Why Aren’t You Rich?
Video.Description: These lesson help students explore the relationship between education and income.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Illusion of Race
Video.Description: The goal of this lesson is to have students investigate both genetic and societal consequences of these often-artificial and evolving classifications.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Macaque Genome: An Interactive Poster
Video.Description: This resource was designed as an accompaniment to a special section of Science, in which five research papers detailed sequencing of the macaque genome.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Rise and Fall of the Mammoths
Video.Description: This lesson will help students to examine the evidence for evolution using the woolly mammoth and related species, of which there happens to be a sizable fossil record.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Satellite Site
Video.Description: This resource lets you become a satellite designer and build a direct transmission television system or a satellite using remote sensing.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Science Inside Alcohol Project E-Book
Video.Description: This interactive e-book guides you through the effects of alcohol on the body and some of the physical and social consequences of underage drinking.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: The Social Ramifications of Alcohol Abuse
Video.Description: This lesson helps students understand how alcohol abuse not only affects the individual engaging in the behavior but also has ramifications for other people and society as a whole.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Tower of Hanoi
Video.Description: This tool features a problem-solving activity in which students must transfer blocks of different sizes from one tower to another.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Two Forks Idaho
Video.Description: This is an interactive science mystery story in which students assume the role of a medical investigator on vacation in Idaho.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Ultrasound: How Does it Work?
Video.Description: This simulation explores ultrasound imaging as a technique used to see inside an object (such as the human body).
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Virtual Frog Dissection App
Video.Description: Virtual Frog Dissection allows students to simulate the experience of a classic animal dissection via an app.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Virtual Laboratories in Probability and Statistics
Video.Description: The goal of this tool is to provide a set of web-based, standards-compliant resources for students and teachers of probability and statistics.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Water Treatment Cycle
Video.Description: This resource allows students to follow a drop of water from the source (in this case a lake) through the treatment process.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: WeatherSchool @ AAAS
Video.Description: Explore how different factors work together to produce both your local community's day-to-day weather and the overall climate for your region of the world.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Weed to Wonder
Video.Description: This app by the Genetic Science Learning Center and the Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory helps tell the story of how a weed was transformed into corn.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Wonderville
Video.Description: This site offers activities, comics, and videos in a range of science fields.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: You and Your Skin
Video.Description: This interactive provides an introduction to the basic structure of the skin, information about how it protects us, and how to care for the skin.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Your Carbon Diet
Video.Description: This interactive allows students to learn about how we use different energy sources and how it affects not only our environment but also our budget.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: Zap!
Video.Description: Test your reaction time with this interactive game! Take control of a hungry frog and catch a fly as soon as you see or hear it.
Video.Author: Science NetLinks

Video.Title: 3D Transmographer
Video.Description: Build your own polygon and transform it in the Cartesian coordinate system. Experiment with reflections across any line, revolving around any line (which yields a 3-D image), rotations about any point, and translations in any direction.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Algebra Four
Video.Description: Students play a generalized version of connect four, gaining the chance to place a piece on the board by solving an algebraic equation. Parameters: Level of difficulty of equations to solve and type of problem. Algebra Four is one of the Interactivate assessment games.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Algebra Quiz
Video.Description: Test your algebra skills by answering questions. This quiz asks you to solve algebraic linear and quadratic equations of one variable. Choose difficulty level, question types, and time limit. Algebra Quiz is one of the Interactivate assessment quizzes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher
Video.Description: Create your own affine cipher for encoding and decoding messages. Input your own constant and multiplier, then input a message to encode.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher II
Video.Description: Encode and decode messages to determine the form for an affine cipher. Input a message to encode, then input your guesses for the constant and multiplier. Caesar Cipher II is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher III
Video.Description: Decode encrypted messages to determine the form for an affine cipher, and practice your reasoning and arithmetic skills. Input your guesses for the multiplier and constant. Caesar Cipher III is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Conic Flyer
Video.Description: Manipulate different types of conic section equations on a coordinate plane using slider bars. Learn how each constant and coefficient affects the resulting graph. Choose from vertical or horizontal parabola, circle, ellipse, and vertical or horizontal hyperbola.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Cross Section Flyer
Video.Description: Explore cross sections of different geometric solids: cone, double cone, cylinder, pyramid, and prism. Manipulate the cross section with slider bars, and see how the graphical representation changes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Data Flyer
Video.Category: Algebra, Graphs, Statistics, Modeling, Statistics, Trigonometry
Video.Description: Enter a set of data points, then derive a function to fit those points. Manipulate the function on a coordinate plane using slider bars. Learn how each constant and coefficient affects the resulting graph.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Derivate
Video.Description: View the graph and the equation of the line tangent to any function at any point on the function.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Equation Solver
Video.Description: This activity helps you understand how to balance an equation. You input the term and the operation. The activity uses that term and operates on both sides of the equation. It then displays the resulting equation. Equation Solver is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Four
Video.Description: Students play a generalized version of connect four, gaining the chance to place a piece after simplifying fractions, converting fractions to decimals and percentages, and answering algebra questions involving fractions. Choose difficulty level, question types, and time. Fraction Four is one of the Interactivate assessment games.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Quiz
Video.Description: Test your fraction skills by answering questions. This quiz asks you to simplify fractions, convert fractions to decimals and percentages, and answer algebra questions involving fractions. Choose difficulty level, question types, and time. Fraction Quiz is one of the Interactivate assessment quizzes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Function Flyer
Video.Description: A more advanced version of Slope Slider, this activity allows the manipulation of the constants and coefficients in any function thereby encouraging the user to explore the effects on the graph of the function by changing those numbers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate very simple functions by trying to guess the algebraic form from inputs and outputs. Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: General Coordinates Game
Video.Description: Investigate the Cartesian coordinate system through identifying the coordinates of a randomly generated point, or requesting that a particular point be plotted. General Coordinates Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Graph Sketcher
Video.Description: Students can create graphs of functions entered as algebraic expressions -- similar to a graphing calculator.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Graphit
Video.Description: Create graphs of functions and sets of ordered pairs on the same coordinate plane. This is like a graphing calculator with advanced viewing options.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Incline
Video.Description: This applet allows the user to make observations about the relationship between speed and position and how both of these are affected by initial velocity and the incline on which the biker is traveling.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: InteGreat!
Video.Description: InteGreat! allows the user to visually explore the idea of integration through approximating the integral value with partitions. The user controls the number of partitions, the upper and lower limits, and the method used to estimate the integral.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Linear Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate linear functions by trying to guess the slope and intercept from inputs and outputs. Linear Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Linear Inequalities
Video.Description: Students create linear inequalities and systems of linear inequalities on a coordinate plane. This is like a graphing calculator with advanced viewing options.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Maze Game
Video.Description: Investigate the Cartesian coordinate system by directing a robot through a mine field laid out on the plane. Maze Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Multi-Function Data Flyer
Video.Description: Enter a set of data points and a function or multiple functions, then manipulate those functions to fit those points. Manipulate the function on a coordinate plane using slider bars. Learn how each constant and coefficient affects the resulting graph.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Multiple Linear Regression
Video.Description: Students compare multiple independent variables as predictors of one dependent variable. Students explore correlation and lines of best-fit.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Number Cruncher
Video.Description: Similar to the original "Function Machine" but lists input and output in a table and will not let the user attempt to guess the rule without having at least two data points. Number Cruncher is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Ordered Simple Plot
Video.Description: Plot ordered pairs on the graph, and they will be connected in the order that they are input. This enables you to decide how the pairs should be connected, rather than having the computer connect them from left to right.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Polar Coordinates
Video.Description: This activity allows the user to explore the polar coordinate system. The applet is similar to GraphIt, but instead allows users to explore the representation of a function in the polar coordinate system.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Positive Linear Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate linear functions with positive slopes by trying to guess the slope and intercept from inputs and outputs. Positive Linear Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Possible or Not
Video.Description: Review the properties of functions by looking at ten different curves and deciding whether or not they meet the criteria for a graph of a function. This activity simply displays the curves - it does not quiz the user.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Recursion
Video.Description: Graph recursive functions by defining f(0)=C and defining f(n) based on f(n-1).
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Regression
Video.Description: Plot a bivariate data set, determine the line of best fit for their data, and then check the accuracy of your line of best fit.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Scatter Plot
Video.Description: Graph ordered pairs and customize the graph title and axis labels. Points are connected from left to right, rather than being connected in the order they are entered.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Sequencer
Video.Description: Learn about number patterns in sequences and recursions by specifying a starting number, multiplier, and add-on. The numbers in the sequence are displayed on a graph, and they are also listed below the graph.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Simple Coordinates Game
Video.Description: Investigate the first quadrant of the Cartesian coordinate system through identifying the coordinates of randomly generated points, or requesting that a particular point be plotted. Simple Coordinates Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Simple Maze Game
Video.Description: Investigate the first quardant of the Cartesian coordinate system by directing a robot through a mine field laid out on the grid. Simple Maze Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Simple Plot
Video.Description: Plot ordered pairs of numbers, either as a scatter plot or with the dots connected. Points are connected from right to left, rather than being connected in the order they are entered.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Slope Slider
Video.Description: Similar to other "flyers", Slope Slider uses slider bars to explore the effect of the multiplier and constant on a linear function of the form f(x)=mx+b. Explore the relationship between slope and intercept in the Cartesian coordinate system.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Two Variable Function Pump
Video.Description: Enter two complex numbers (z and c) as ordered pairs of real numbers, then click a button to iterate step by step. The iterates are graphed in the x-y plane and printed out in table form. This is an introduction to the idea of prisoners/escapees in iterated functions and the calculation of fractal Julia sets.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Venn Diagrams
Video.Description: Classify various objects into categories in a Venn Diagram. Learn how categories in Venn Diagrams work. Venn Diagrams is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Vertical Line Test
Video.Description: Learn about the vertical line test for functions by trying to connect points in the plane to build a function. When you have connected all of the points, you will be told if your graph is a valid graph of a function. Vertical Line Test is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Whole Number Cruncher
Video.Description: Give input to the Whole Number Cruncher and try to guess what it did from the output it generates. This activity only generates multiplication and addition functions to avoid outputting any negative numbers. Whole Number Cruncher is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Cross Section Flyer
Video.Description: Explore cross sections of different geometric solids: cone, double cone, cylinder, pyramid, and prism. Manipulate the cross section with slider bars, and see how the graphical representation changes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Derivate
Video.Description: View the graph and the equation of the line tangent to any function at any point on the function.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Function Flyer
Video.Description: A more advanced version of Slope Slider, this activity allows the manipulation of the constants and coefficients in any function thereby encouraging the user to explore the effects on the graph of the function by changing those numbers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Function Revolution
Video.Description: This activity allows the user to find the volume and surface area of various functions as they are rotated around axes. This applet can be used to practice finding integrals using the disk and washer methods of calculating volume.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Graph Sketcher
Video.Description: Students can create graphs of functions entered as algebraic expressions -- similar to a graphing calculator.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Graphit
Video.Description: Create graphs of functions and sets of ordered pairs on the same coordinate plane. This is like a graphing calculator with advanced viewing options.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: InteGreat!
Video.Description: InteGreat! allows the user to visually explore the idea of integration through approximating the integral value with partitions. The user controls the number of partitions, the upper and lower limits, and the method used to estimate the integral.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Multi-Function Data Flyer
Video.Description: Enter a set of data points and a function or multiple functions, then manipulate those functions to fit those points. Manipulate the function on a coordinate plane using slider bars. Learn how each constant and coefficient affects the resulting graph.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Parametric GraphIt
Video.Description: This activity allows the user to plot ordered pairs and parametric equations on the same coordinate plane. The applet is similar to GraphIt, but instead allows users to explore the parametric representation of a function.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Polar Coordinates
Video.Description: This activity allows the user to explore the polar coordinate system. The applet is similar to GraphIt, but instead allows users to explore the representation of a function in the polar coordinate system.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Rabbits and Wolves
Video.Description: Experiment with a simple ecosystem consisting of grass, rabbits, and wolves, learning about probabilities, chaos, and simulation.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Regression
Video.Description: Plot a bivariate data set, determine the line of best fit for their data, and then check the accuracy of your line of best fit.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: A Better Fire!!
Video.Description: Students run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Forest density, wind direction, size of forest.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Adjustable Spinner
Video.Description: Create a game spinner with variable sized sectors to look at experimental and theoretical probabilities. Parameters: Sizes of sectors, number of sectors, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Advanced Monty Hall
Video.Description: Choose one of N doors to experimentally determine the odds of winning the grand prize behind one of the doors, as in the TV program "Let's Make a Deal." Parameters: Number of doors, number of trials, staying or switching between the two remaining doors.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Another Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Students work step-by-step through the generation of a different Hilbert-like Curve (a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it), allowing them to explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Arithmetic Four
Video.Description: Students play a generalized version of connect four, gaining the chance to place a piece on the board by answering arithmetic questions (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division). Parameters: time, difficulty level, types of questions. Arithmetic Four is one of the Interactivate assessment games.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Arithmetic Quiz
Video.Description: Arithmetic Quiz gives the user randomized questions to answer on arithmetic with whole numbers and integers. Parameters: Level of difficulty and types of questions. Arithmetic Quiz is one of the Interactivate assessment quizzes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Buffon's Needle
Video.Description: Experiment with a simulation to get an approximation of Pi by dropping a needle on a lined sheet of paper.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher
Video.Description: Create your own affine cipher for encoding and decoding messages. Input your own constant and multiplier, then input a message to encode.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher II
Video.Description: Encode and decode messages to determine the form for an affine cipher. Input a message to encode, then input your guesses for the constant and multiplier. Caesar Cipher II is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Caesar Cipher III
Video.Description: Decode encrypted messages to determine the form for an affine cipher, and practice your reasoning and arithmetic skills. Input your guesses for the multiplier and constant. Caesar Cipher III is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Cantor's Comb
Video.Description: Learn about fractions between 0 and 1 by repeatedly deleting portions of a line segment, and also learn about properties of fractal objects. Parameter: fraction of the segment to be deleted each time.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Clock Arithmetic
Video.Description: Work with various types of clocks in order to learn about modular arithmetic operations. Parameters: Number of hours on the clock.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coin Toss
Video.Description: Simulation of a coin toss allowing the user to input the number of flips. Toss results can be viewed as a list of individual outcomes, ratios, or table.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle
Video.Description: Color numbers in Pascal's Triangle by rolling a number and then clicking on all entries that are multiples of the number rolled, thereby practicing multiplication tables, investigating number patterns, and investigating fractal patterns. Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle
Video.Description: Color numbers in Pascal's Triangle by rolling a number and then clicking on all entries that have the same remainder when divided by the number rolled, thereby practicing division and remainders, investigating number patterns, and investigating fractal patterns. Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Crazy Choices Game
Video.Description: Compare theoretical and experimental probabilities, using dice, cards, spinners, or coin tosses. Three different probabilities can be compared at once. Parameters: Type of probabilities, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Dice Table
Video.Description: Experiment with the outcome distribution for a roll of two dice by simulating a dice throwing game. Parameters: Which player wins with which total rolled.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Directable Fire!!
Video.Description: Run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Probability that a tree will set fire to each of its eight neighbors.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Experimental Probability
Video.Description: Experiment with probability using a fixed size section spinner, a variable section spinner, two regular 6-sided dice or customized dice.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. First enter all the factorizations of a number, then draw each factor set as an area on the grid. Factorize is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize 2
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. As you draw each factor set on the grid, the factors will be listed. Factorize 2 is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fire!!
Video.Description: Run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Probability that a tree catches fire if its neighbor is on fire.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fractal Dimensions
Video.Description: Determine the fractal dimensions of several line-deformation fractals. Input the scale factor and number of similar copies, and the dimension will be calculated. Fractal Dimensions is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fractured Pictures
Video.Description: Generate complicated geometric fractals by specifying starting polygon and scale factor.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate very simple functions by trying to guess the algebraic form from inputs and outputs. Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Generalized Monty Hall
Video.Description: Run a simulation to generate results from running the Monty Hall for multiple trials. This is similar to the game show "Let's Make A Deal", where you choose one of N doors in hopes of finding a grand prize behind one of the doors. Parameters: Number of doors, number of trials, staying, or switching between the two remaining doors.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Step through the generation of a Hilbert Curve -- a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it, and explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Julia Sets
Video.Description: Enter a complex value for "c" in the form of an ordered pair of real numbers. The applet draws the fractal Julia set for that seed value.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Koch's Snowflake
Video.Description: Step through the generation of the Koch Snowflake -- a fractal made from deforming the sides of a triangle, and explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Linear Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate linear functions by trying to guess the slope and intercept from inputs and outputs. Linear Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Marbles
Video.Description: Learn about sampling with and without replacement by randomly drawing marbles from a bag. Parameters: Number and color of marbles in the bag, replacement rule.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Number Base Clocks
Video.Description: Visually explore counting and place value with different number bases, from base 2 to base 16, and up to the hundreds place using a clock like interface. The activity also allows you to look at the numbers on the clock in base 10 or in your other chosen base to explore the relationship between those values.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Number Cruncher
Video.Description: Similar to the original "Function Machine" but lists input and output in a table and will not let the user attempt to guess the rule without having at least two data points. Number Cruncher is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Positive Linear Function Machine
Video.Description: Students investigate linear functions with positive slopes by trying to guess the slope and intercept from inputs and outputs. Positive Linear Function Machine is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Possible or Not
Video.Description: Review the properties of functions by looking at ten different curves and deciding whether or not they meet the criteria for a graph of a function. This activity simply displays the curves - it does not quiz the user.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Racing Game with One Die
Video.Description: Simulate a game where two players each roll a die, and the lucky player moves one step to the finish. Parameters: what rolls win and how many steps to the finish line.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Racing Game with Two Dice
Video.Description: Simulate a game where "N" players roll two dice, and the lucky player has an advantage for reaching the finish. Parameters: the number of players, number of trials and length of the race.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Recursion
Video.Description: Graph recursive functions by defining f(0)=C and defining f(n) based on f(n-1).
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Sequencer
Video.Description: Learn about number patterns in sequences and recursions by specifying a starting number, multiplier, and add-on. The numbers in the sequence are displayed on a graph, and they are also listed below the graph.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Sierpinski's Carpet
Video.Description: Step through the generation of Sierpinski's Carpet -- a fractal made from subdividing a square into nine smaller squares and cutting the middle one out. Explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Sierpinski's Triangle
Video.Description: Step through the generation of Sierpinski's Triangle -- a fractal made from subdividing a triangle into four smaller triangles and cutting the middle one out. Explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Simple Monty Hall
Video.Description: Choose one of three doors to experimentally determine the odds of winning the grand prize behind one of the doors, as in the TV program "Let's Make a Deal." Parameters: Staying or switching between the two remaining doors.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Spinner
Video.Description: Create a game spinner with one to twelve sectors in order to look at experimental and theoretical probabilities. Parameters: Number of sectors, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Tables and Chairs
Video.Description: Explore perimeter through rectangular and straight-line arrangements of tables, calculating the number of chairs needed to surround different arrangements. Tables and Chairs is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: The Mandelbrot Set
Video.Description: Explore fractals by investigating the relationships between the Mandelbrot set and Julia sets.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Tortoise and Hare Race
Video.Description: Step through the tortoise and hare race, based on Zeno's paradox, to learn about the multiplication of fractions and about convergence of an infinite sequence of numbers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Triple Venn Diagram Shape Sorter
Video.Description: Sort colored shapes into a three circle Venn Diagram.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Two Colors Applet
Video.Description: Choose one of three boxes and choose one ball from the box to look at conditional probabilities. Parameters: Number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Venn Diagram Shape Sorter
Video.Description: Sort colored shapes into a Venn diagram based on various characteristics. Venn Diagram Shape Sorter is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Venn Diagrams
Video.Description: Classify various objects into categories in a Venn Diagram. Learn how categories in Venn Diagrams work. Venn Diagrams is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Vertical Line Test
Video.Description: Learn about the vertical line test for functions by trying to connect points in the plane to build a function. When you have connected all of the points, you will be told if your graph is a valid graph of a function. Vertical Line Test is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Whole Number Cruncher
Video.Description: Give input to the Whole Number Cruncher and try to guess what it did from the output it generates. This activity only generates multiplication and addition functions to avoid outputting any negative numbers. Whole Number Cruncher is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: A Better Fire!!
Video.Description: Students run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Forest density, wind direction, size of forest.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Adjustable Spinner
Video.Description: Create a game spinner with variable sized sectors to look at experimental and theoretical probabilities. Parameters: Sizes of sectors, number of sectors, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Another Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Students work step-by-step through the generation of a different Hilbert-like Curve (a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it), allowing them to explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Arithmetic Four
Video.Description: Students play a generalized version of connect four, gaining the chance to place a piece on the board by answering arithmetic questions (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division). Parameters: time, difficulty level, types of questions. Arithmetic Four is one of the Interactivate assessment games.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Arithmetic Quiz
Video.Description: Arithmetic Quiz gives the user randomized questions to answer on arithmetic with whole numbers and integers. Parameters: Level of difficulty and types of questions. Arithmetic Quiz is one of the Interactivate assessment quizzes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Bounded Fraction Finder
Video.Description: The same as "Bounded Fraction Pointer" but there is no arrow to help the user determine the value of a fraction between the two endpoints. Bounded Fraction Finder is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Bounded Fraction Pointer
Video.Description: Determine the value of two fractions you have chosen (which are represented as points on a number line). Then find a fraction whose value is between your two fractions (using an arrow on the number line as a guide) and determine its value. Bounded Fraction Pointer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Circle Graph
Video.Description: Enter your own data categories and the value of each category to create a pie chart. There are also built in data sets which can be viewed.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coin Toss
Video.Description: Simulation of a coin toss allowing the user to input the number of flips. Toss results can be viewed as a list of individual outcomes, ratios, or table.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle
Video.Description: Color numbers in Pascal's Triangle by rolling a number and then clicking on all entries that are multiples of the number rolled, thereby practicing multiplication tables, investigating number patterns, and investigating fractal patterns. Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle
Video.Description: Color numbers in Pascal's Triangle by rolling a number and then clicking on all entries that have the same remainder when divided by the number rolled, thereby practicing division and remainders, investigating number patterns, and investigating fractal patterns. Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Converter
Video.Description: Converts fractions to decimals and decimals to fractions. Observe the relationships between fractions and decimals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Crazy Choices Game
Video.Description: Compare theoretical and experimental probabilities, using dice, cards, spinners, or coin tosses. Three different probabilities can be compared at once. Parameters: Type of probabilities, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Dice Table
Video.Description: Experiment with the outcome distribution for a roll of two dice by simulating a dice throwing game. Parameters: Which player wins with which total rolled.

Video.Title: Directable Fire!!
Video.Description: Run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Probability that a tree will set fire to each of its eight neighbors.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Equivalent Fractions Finder
Video.Description: Visually represent two unique fractions that are equivalent to a given fraction. The fractional value is shown on a number line after you check to see if your fraction is correct. Equivalent Fraction Finder is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Equivalent Fractions Pointer
Video.Description: Visually represent two unique fractions that are equivalent to a given fraction. The fractional value is shown on a number line as you color in the fraction. Equivalent Fraction Pointer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. First enter all the factorizations of a number, then draw each factor set as an area on the grid. Factorize is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize 2
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. As you draw each factor set on the grid, the factors will be listed. Factorize 2 is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.

Video.Title: Fire!!
Video.Description: Run a simulation of how a fire will spread through a stand of trees, learning about probability and chaos. Parameters: Probability that a tree catches fire if its neighbor is on fire.

Video.Title: Fraction Finder
Video.Description: Determine the value of two given fractions represented as points on a number line. Then find a fraction whose value is between the two given fractions and determine its value. Fraction Finder is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Four
Video.Description: Students play a generalized version of connect four, gaining the chance to place a piece after simplifying fractions, converting fractions to decimals and percentages, and answering algebra questions involving fractions. Choose difficulty level, question types, and time. Fraction Four is one of the Interactivate assessment games.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Pointer
Video.Description: Determine the value of two given fractions represented as points on a number line. Then find a fraction whose value is between the two given fractions (using an arrow on the number line as a guide) and determine its value. Fraction Pointer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Quiz
Video.Description: Test your fraction skills by answering questions. This quiz asks you to simplify fractions, convert fractions to decimals and percentages, and answer algebra questions involving fractions. Choose difficulty level, question types, and time. Fraction Quiz is one of the Interactivate assessment quizzes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fraction Sorter
Video.Description: Visualize fractions by coloring in the appropriate portions of either a circle or a square, then order those fractions from least to greatest. Fraction Sorter is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Step through the generation of a Hilbert Curve -- a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it, and explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Julia Sets
Video.Description: Enter a complex value for "c" in the form of an ordered pair of real numbers. The applet draws the fractal Julia set for that seed value.

Video.Title: Sierpinski's Carpet
Video.Description: Step through the generation of Sierpinski's Carpet -- a fractal made from subdividing a square into nine smaller squares and cutting the middle one out. Explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Sierpinski's Triangle
Video.Description: Step through the generation of Sierpinski's Triangle -- a fractal made from subdividing a triangle into four smaller triangles and cutting the middle one out. Explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Single Fraction Finder
Video.Description: Determine the value of a given fraction represented as a point on a number line. Then find a fraction whose value is a given fraction. Fraction Pointer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.

Video.Title: Single Fraction Pointer
Video.Description: Determine the value of a given fraction represented as a point on a number line. Then find a fraction whose value is the given fraction using an arrow on the number line as a guide. Single Fraction Pointer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.

Video.Title: Spinner
Video.Description: Create a game spinner with one to twelve sectors in order to look at experimental and theoretical probabilities. Parameters: Number of sectors, number of trials.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: The Mandelbrot Set
Video.Description: Explore fractals by investigating the relationships between the Mandelbrot set and Julia sets.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Angles
Video.Description: Practice your knowledge of acute, obtuse, and alternate angles. Also, practice relationships between angles - vertical, adjacent, alternate, same-side, and corresponding. Angles is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Another Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Students work step-by-step through the generation of a different Hilbert-like Curve (a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it), allowing them to explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Area Explorer
Video.Description: Learn the relationship between perimeter and area. A shape will be automatically generated with the perimeter that you choose. Calculate the area of this shape. Area Explorer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Bar Graph Sorter
Video.Description: Sort colored shapes into a bar graph. Practice sorting by shape or by color. Appropriate for elementary grades. Bar Graph Sorter is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Cantor's Comb
Video.Description: Learn about fractions between 0 and 1 by repeatedly deleting portions of a line segment, and also learn about properties of fractal objects. Parameter: fraction of the segment to be deleted each time.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Clock Wise
Video.Description: Practice reading a clock, input times for the clock to display, or let the clock generate random times for you to read. Choose from three difficulty levels. Clock Wise is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle
Video.Description: Color numbers in Pascal's Triangle by rolling a number and then clicking on all entries that are multiples of the number rolled, thereby practicing multiplication tables, investigating number patterns, and investigating fractal patterns. Coloring Multiples in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.

Video.Title: Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle

Coloring Remainders in Pascal's Triangle is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Conic Flyer
Video.Description: Manipulate different types of conic section equations on a coordinate plane using slider bars. Learn how each constant and coefficient affects the resulting graph. Choose from vertical or horizontal parabola, circle, ellipse, and vertical or horizontal hyperbola.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Cross Section Flyer
Video.Description: Explore cross sections of different geometric solids: cone, double cone, cylinder, pyramid, and prism. Manipulate the cross section with slider bars, and see how the graphical representation changes.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Elapsed Time
Video.Description: Practice finding elapsed time given a starting time and an ending time. Elapsed Time is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Elapsed Time Two
Video.Description: Given a starting time and elapsed time practice finding the ending time. Elapsed Time Two is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. First enter all the factorizations of a number, then draw each factor set as an area on the grid. Factorize is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Factorize 2
Video.Description: Visualize factors through building rectangular areas on a grid. As you draw each factor set on the grid, the factors will be listed. Factorize 2 is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Flake Maker
Video.Description: Create your own fractals by drawing a "line deformation rule" and stepping through the generation of a geometric fractal. Parameters: Grid type, number of bending points on the line.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Floor Tiles
Video.Description: Build a "floor tile" by dragging the corners of a quadrilateral. Learn about tessellation of quadrilateral figures when the shape you built is tiled over an area.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fractal Dimensions
Video.Description: Determine the fractal dimensions of several line-deformation fractals. Input the scale factor and number of similar copies, and the dimension will be calculated. Fractal Dimensions is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Fractured Pictures
Video.Description: Generate complicated geometric fractals by specifying starting polygon and scale factor.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: General Coordinates Game
Video.Description: Investigate the Cartesian coordinate system through identifying the coordinates of a randomly generated point, or requesting that a particular point be plotted. General Coordinates Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Hilbert Curve Generator
Video.Description: Step through the generation of a Hilbert Curve -- a fractal made from deforming a line by bending it, and explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Image Tool
Video.Description: Measure angles, distances, and areas in several different images (choices include maps, aerial photos, and others). A scale feature allows the user to set the scale used for measuring distances and areas.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Julia Sets
Video.Description: Enter a complex value for "c" in the form of an ordered pair of real numbers. The applet draws the fractal Julia set for that seed value.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Koch's Snowflake
Video.Description: Step through the generation of the Koch Snowflake -- a fractal made from deforming the sides of a triangle, and explore number patterns in sequences and geometric properties of fractals.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Maze Game
Video.Description: Investigate the Cartesian coordinate system by directing a robot through a mine field laid out on the plane. Maze Game is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Ordered Simple Plot
Video.Description: Plot ordered pairs on the graph, and they will be connected in the order that they are input. This enables you to decide how the pairs should be connected, rather than having the computer connect them from left to right.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Perimeter Explorer
Video.Description: Learn the relationship between perimeter and area. A shape will be automatically generated with the area that you choose. Calculate the perimeter of this shape. Perimeter Explorer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Pythagorean Explorer
Video.Description: Calculate the length of one side of an automatically generated right triangle by using the Pythagorean Theorem, and then check your answers. Pythagorean Explorer is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Shape Builder
Video.Description: This activity operates in one of two modes: auto draw and create shape mode, allowing you to explore relationships between area and perimeter. Shape Builder is one of the Interactivate assessment explorers.
Video.Author: shodor.org

Video.Title: Shape Explorer
